title: Galio: Why is he melee?
body:
I know Galio's getting a rework eventually, and that he's actually in a pretty decent spot for now in terms of win-rate, but I just have problems with the way his kit is structured. He's a melee caster whose spells are closer to most ranged champions' range. Galio has two abilities that function according to this melee playstyle--a W that reduces the free damage he takes while running towards enemies, and an ultimate that does a decent sized taunt. 

I DO NOT want to be read as meaning his ult or his W are necessarily "bad" abilities, but they're the ones that make sense for an AP melee champion.

Q serves as a slow, if you can count the tiny slow on a champion it provides (in this age of mobility) as a valid CC tool to get in range. It mostly gets used as a damage nuke if he's building AP.

E serves as a speedboost for the team, but it's miniscule in width, and only works in one direction. It's literally a champion ability version of Elixir of Iron's movespeed buff that does some decent damage. 

Thematically and playstyle-wise, Galio's ranged poke feels at odds with his melee autos. Why not throw gusts of wind with his wings instead of just punching things?

Could someone shed light on this idiosyncrasy?

So I did a bunch of Galio lore, guide, and gargoyle research and found the following:

From current Galio lore:
-is a protector of what his master believed in 
(Demacia's outer border towns; the less protected ones)
-has come to terms with his master's death due to Poppy inspiring him (so no vengeance).
-Tireless and always hardworking; his past failure drives this.
-Honourable and sensitive to emotions.

Stuff Galio mains find core to current Galio:
-waveclear (holding his own in lane via that waveclear)
-ult (super thematic to the champ as a protector; takes the punishment upon himself)
a high moment when playing as him.
-a way to get into the fray; almost universal mention of E as a siege tool "it can be used to haste the wave/teammates" in the guides.  Needing flash to initiate is important for counterplay reasons (like Annie).

Stuff they find annoying:
-mana hungry
-long cooldowns
-low mana pool
-fairly useless without ult
-above four are more 'felt' since without his cds he is melee.
-poor ratios/scaling overall

Gargoyle research:
-they can't fly, only climb structures/terrain and then glide on the winds
-have regenerative powers when turned to stone.
-damaging abilities seem to be limited to mid/long range wind spells and clawing with wings or other clawed appendages.  Not sure how last-hitting with wing tips would look lol.
-territorial and very protective of kin and allies.
-lore is laced with having resistances to poison/magic damage.
-in some cases landing on people with their sheer weight is listed as a valid damaging ability.  This would fit well with many of Galio's VO lines like "assault from above" etc.
